lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Runny.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Runny.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
* The main class for the chatbot application.
* Runny is a chatbot that helps to manage tasks;
* Some things that it can do includes adding todo, events, deadlines.
* It can also delete and find tasks as well as mark and unmark tasks.
* Creates a Runny instance with the provided file path.
* @param filePath The file path for storing task data.

printMessage("Goodbye! Hope to see you again soon :)");
assertThrows(RunnyException.class, () -> new DeleteCommand("-1").doCommand(null, null, new TaskList()));
new DeleteCommand("1").doCommand(new Ui(), new Storage("./data/testCase.txt"), tasks);
assertThrows(RunnyException.class, () -> new MarkCommand("-1").doCommand(null, null, new TaskList()));
assertThrows(RunnyException.class, () -> new MarkCommand("2").doCommand(null, null, new TaskList()));
new MarkCommand("1").doCommand(new Ui(), new Storage("./data/testCase.txt"), tasks);
new DeleteCommand("1").doCommand(new Ui(), new Storage("./data/testCase.txt"), tasks);
assertThrows(RunnyException.class, () -> new UnmarkCommand("-1").doCommand(null, null, new TaskList()));
assertThrows(RunnyException.class, () -> new UnmarkCommand("2").doCommand(null, null, new TaskList()));
new UnmarkCommand("1").doCommand(new Ui(), new Storage("./data/testCase.txt"), tasks);
new DeleteCommand("1").doCommand(new Ui(), new Storage("./data/testCase.txt"), tasks);
